Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of education to post subdistrict maps online
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring DOE to post subdistrict maps online.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of citywide administrative services to notify the department of education and the school construction authority when city-owned or leased property of an adequate size is determined to have no current use
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring DCAS to notify the DOE and the school construction authority when city-owned or leased property of an adequate size is determined to have no current use.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of education to post information regarding the process used in determining identified seat need
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of education to post information regarding the process used in determining identified seat need.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the creation of a school siting task force
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Creation of a school siting task force.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York City School Construction Authority to more clearly communicate to the general public how city residents can submit potential school sites and the guidelines used by the School Construction Authority in considering whether a suggested school site meets the evaluation standards used by the authority.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: NYC School Construction Authority to more clearly communicate to the general public how city residents can submit potential school sites and the guidelines used in considering whether a suggested school site meets the evaluation standards used by the auth
